definition: to eat out/to eat at a restaurant
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
variant of 館|馆[guan3]
building/shop/term for certain service establishments/embassy or consulate/schoolroom (old)/CL:家[jia1]
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You always have water when dining out.
sentences.chinese: 下馆子的时候你总要点水喝。

sentences.english: Ms. Gail's parents, who had been living comfortably in retirement, quit dining out.
sentences.chinese: 过着悠闲退休生活的父母也不再下馆子吃饭了。

sentences.english: Don’t miss the highlight of Paris evening: eating out.
sentences.chinese: 别错过了巴黎夜晚的高潮:下馆子。

sentences.english: Residents in Shanghai paid the highest price for dining out as each time they spent RMB88 per person.
sentences.chinese: 其中上海市民下馆子最贵，人均餐饮消费88元。

sentences.english: "It's more expensive than eating in a restaurant, " complained one driver who gave his surname as Lu.
sentences.chinese: “这甚至比下馆子还要贵”，一位姓陆的司机抱怨说。

sentences.english: LanGui ChengXiang find red flag eat out, after he listened to her arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 兰贵成想后找文红旗下馆子吃饭，他全听她安排。

sentences.english: "It's more expensive than eating in a restaurant," complained one driver who gave his surname as Lu.
sentences.chinese: “这甚至比下馆子还要贵”，一位姓陆的司机抱怨说。

sentences.english: Mr. Fernandez takes his girlfriend out to dinner more frequently.
sentences.chinese: 费尔南德兹则可以更多地请女友下馆子吃饭。
